Node.definition: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּה) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= king of Egypt

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the fives cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a certain quantity that fill a certain container

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which humans utter a high pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= male horse; ► mainly used for carrying soldiers and drawing chariots; ≈ associated with power, strength, and warfare
= a group of chariots (מֶרְכָּבָה) usually owned by one single person
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

= ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made as a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outher rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: weak of hands; hence: = state in which humans lack the confidence to perform a certain event
literally: weak of hands; hence: = state in which humans lack the confidence to perform a certain event

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
literally: to cut off; hence: = causative process by which a certain category of people or animals are removed from a particular group
= town; ◄ on the Phoenician coast; ► famous as sea port
= town; ◄ Phoenician city north of Tyre (צֹר) famous as a seaport and sometimes referred to as Great Sidon; marked the northern boundary of the Promised Land
= a person who was able to flee from danger
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
= name of area, probably to be identified with Crete; ► land of origin of the Philistines

= a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the fives cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)
= process by which humans or objects are removed from existence, through death or total destruction
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the five cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

Node.gloss: to cut oneself|to gash oneself|to lacerate oneself
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans inflict wounds on their body with a knife, ► as a sign of mourning, or in order to reinforce one's prayer
= exclamation expressing grief and dismay
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= referent to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= state in which an inanimate object does not move
= to move back to the place where one comes from

= case or bag about the size and shape of a sword, attached to a circular strap or belt that could be hung over the shoulder or tied around the waist, or to a combination of a belt and a shoulder strap; ► used to cover and to carry the sword
= process by which animals or objects in motion stop moving

Node.gloss: to stand still|to be still|to wait
Node.definition: = to refrain from moving

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= state in which an inanimate object does not move
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the five cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)
literally: seacoast, but extended to the people living in that area; hence: = people; ◄ living along the coast of the sea
literally: the sea; hence: = a large body of salt water located between Europe and Africa, west of Canaan/Israel
literally: to set; hence: = action by which humans make a certain decision regarding something
